newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Berlusconi meets Prodi after offer of deal.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Berlusconi meets Prodi after offer of deal.

text.p: Prime Minister Romano Prodi and opposition leader Silvio Berlsuconi held talks on Friday, a day after Berlusconi offered the government a deal on welfare reforms to boost Italy's EMU hopes.
The prime minister's office said the talks began at 0800 GMT. They were believed to be still in progress an hour later. A statement from Prodi's office gave no details.

Berlusconi, a former prime minister, explained his offer in a letter to leftist newspaper L'Unita on Wednesday. He proposed striking "a transparent compromise" with the government and establishing an "understanding for Europe" to help meet the EMU commitments while reforming Italy's welfare state.
Prodi's centre-left government announced on Wednesday it was drawing up a mini-budget to ensure it would be ready for European economic and monetary union in 1999. -- Rome newsroom +396 678 2501
